summary: This is an email chain from September 2021 between personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and an FBI Special Agent, regarding the coordination of discovery materials (specifically 1A reports and original notes) for case 31E-MM-108062. The emails focus on verifying and producing witness interview notes as part of the 3500 material production for an upcoming deadline.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: The FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk, who sent the initial 1A list spreadsheet for case 31E-MM-108062.

events.title: Initial 1A List Submission
events.description: An FBI Special Agent sends a spreadsheet listing 1A reports for case 31E-MM-108062 to the U.S. Attorney's Office, including information on which disks the reports are stored.

events.title: Request for Original Interview Notes
events.description: A follow-up email requests the FBI pull 44 files listed as 'original notes' from the spreadsheet and provide them to the U.S. Attorney's Office to compare against existing materials for an upcoming production deadline.

keyFacts: The document pertains to case number 31E-MM-108062, which is being handled by the FBI's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk in New York.
The U.S. Attorney's Office is actively preparing 3500 material for production, indicating ongoing legal proceedings related to the case.
There is a specific request for 44 files of 'original notes' from witness interviews to ensure complete discovery production.
The communication highlights coordination challenges between the prosecution and law enforcement in managing and verifying discovery materials.
The emails reference a spreadsheet that tracks 1A reports and their storage locations (disks), showing organized evidence management.
